Presented by VideoLAN President Jean-Baptiste Kempf, the demo highlighted the use of open-source AI models to generate and translate subtitles into over 100 languages completely offline, ensuring privacy and eliminating the need for cloud services. This feature is built directly into the VLC app, distinguishing it from earlier plug-ins that relied on platforms like OpenAI's Whisper. While the full rollout date hasn't been disclosed, the advancement demonstrates a significant leap in local AI integration for media playback. Additionally, VideoLAN announced that VLC has surpassed 6 billion downloads and continues to grow in active users despite the rise of streaming services.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":37},"pub_date":1736431670,"attribution":"www.theverge.com"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"www.axios.com","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.axios.com/2023/10/10/ai-videos-transation-languages-lipdub","title":"Startup's AI app dubs videos in different languages","snippet":"A new AI-powered app called Lipdub, developed by New York-based startup Captions, enables users to dub their videos into any of 28 languages—maintaining their own voice and syncing lip movements to the new audio. Available for free on iOS, the app uses generative AI and zero-shot models, which don’t require training on individual speakers, to achieve natural-looking results. Users simply record a video with their face visible, and within minutes receive a dubbed version in the selected language.\n\nCaptions CEO Gaurav Misra highlights the app’s goal of breaking language barriers and giving broader access to storytelling. Despite its impressive capabilities, the technology also raises concerns about the potential for realistic video manipulation. Looking ahead, Misra envisions that generative AI will support real-time language translations in video conferencing and live broadcasts, potentially revolutionizing communication across languages.","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"news","ref_index":40},"pub_date":1696932000,"attribution":"www.axios.com"}]},{"type":"search_result","url":"https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.05126","title":"SyncVoice: Towards Video Dubbing with Vision-Augmented Pretrained TTS Model","snippet":"","ref_id":{"turn_index":0,"ref_type":"academia","ref_index":49},"pub_date":null,"attribution":"arxiv.org"},{"type":"search_result_group","domain":"notta.ai","entries":[{"type":"search_result","url":"https://www.notta.ai/en/blog/best-video-translator-apps?utm_source=chatgpt.com","title":"7 Best AI Video Translator Apps of 2025 [Tested]","snippet":"Jun 20, 2024 — Here is a comprehensive list of best video translators. 1. response_text: Here are some popular AI tools/apps that change the language of videos (translate + dub with AI):  Apps/Web tools that do it:  Synthesia – AI video translation with voice dubbing and lip-sync in many languages. Synthesia [https://www.synthesia.io/post/best-video-translator-apps]  Dubly.AI – Automatically translates and lip-syncs your videos into other languages. Dubly.AI [https://dubly.ai/]  Maestra.ai – AI translator with voice cloning, subtitles, and dubbing in 125+ languages. Maestra AI [https://maestra.ai/tools/video-translator]  Vozo.ai – Online translator that creates dubbed audio with voice cloning and lip sync. Vozo [https://www.vozo.ai/video-translate]  HeyGen Video Translator – Translate videos into 175+ languages. HeyGen [https://www.heygen.com/translate]  Canva AI Video Translator / Dubbing – Built-in AI video language change feature in Canva. Canva+1 [https://www.canva.com/features/ai-video-translator/]  Flixier – AI video translator with 130+ languages and AI voice options. Flixier [https://flixier.com/tools/translate-your-video-online]  Dub AI (iOS/Android) – App for translating/dubbing personal videos. App Store [https://apps.apple.com/us/app/dub-ai-video-translator-app/id6612030937]  AI Video Translator & Dubbing (Android) – Mobile app to translate and dub videos. Google Play [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en&id=ai.voiser.aidubbing]  Other options you might see:  Rask.ai – Large scale video localization & dubbing. Rask [https://www.rask.ai/]  Adobe Firefly Video Translate – Translate videos with AI. adobe.com [https://www.adobe.com/products/firefly/features/translate-video.html]  If you want a simple mobile app, Dub AI or the Android AI Video Translator & Dubbing are good choices. For professional quality with lip-sync and voice cloning, tools like Synthesia, Maestra, or Vozo are popular. Synthesia+2Maestra AI+2 [https://www.synthesia.io/post/best-video-translator-apps]
